instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
helo, my friend I'm with this mac that has been in contact with liquid, the machine seems to turn on, but it doesn't show an image. the components D330 and <DIODE>D3300</DIODE> are missing and it is slightly cracked. The region around <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> suffered from oxidation, where I had to make a jumper in the <SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_P</SIGNAL> <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>/<CAPACITOR>C5452</CAPACITOR> mesh.

Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13.09V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42V; <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.13v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
Missing image and backlight at same time?

Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I noticed that the <SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_P</SIGNAL> track didn't have a pad connection to the board, so I performed a jumper from IC <CHIP>U8400</CHIP> to <CAPACITOR>C5452</CAPACITOR>.

Mac powers the external SSD, but does not start the external ssd. No image on HDMI.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
No reason to search for image/backlight, if you cannot confirm USB activity.
I suppose the board has more corroded points...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: Not from the image and not even the sound signal that it is connecting, can be the BIOS causing it ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: Do you think Bios is corrupted, and putting another BIOS file will solve it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I can suppose that, but not sure.
If you do not try, will never know...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I rewrote BIOS, but it still has the same defect.
In the thermal camera it starts <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> the component that presents greater heating.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: If you connect charger to the other port, <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR> is still the hotest?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: In the first door there is no heating in <TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>, but in the second door yes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
You still have board areas affected by liquid, maybe even CPU is bad.
You should try first to heat BGA chips with quality flux and pass the board through ultrasonic cleaner at the end.
